sub_title: Vice President Data Science, Research Content Operations at Elsevier
summary:
PhD in Text Mining. Vice President Data Science, Research Content Operations, at Elsevier B.V. in Amsterdam, leading several of Elsevier's projects and research initiatives in the areas of Natural Language Processing, Text Mining, Machine Learning, Taxonomy and Ontology-based services, and QA of domain specific scientific content. Managing Elsevier's research collaborations in all areas of Artificial Intelligence, with both public and private entities, where Elsevier contributes with data science, content and business expertise as a trusted partner.

 - More than 60 publications in International Refereed Conferences and Journals, among which IJCAI, ACL, PKDD, CIKM, COLING, EMNLP, TPDL, CICLing, JAIR, BMC Bioinformatics, and BMC Journal of Biomedical Semantics. 

Past highlights: 

 - Scientific Coordinator of 3 European Research Projects, 

 - Co-editor of Springer volume for Multimedia Information Extraction, 

 - Participant as WP Leader, Technical Manager or Researcher in more than 10 research projects

 - Program committee member in international conferences (e.g., IJCAI 2011, EMNLP 2011, CICLing 2011-2013), 

 - External reviewer in several international peer-reviewed fora, among which SIGMOD, PKDD, WWW, ICDM, ISMB, ECCB.

 - External reviewer in several computer science and bioinformatics journals, among which IEEE Intelligent Systems, BMC Bioinformatics, and IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering, 

 - Editorial board member of the International Journal on Web Engineering and Technology (IJWET)

Current research work has attracted more than 1,500 citations from peer-reviewed conference or journal papers, excluding self-citations. H-Index is 16 (source: Scopus, June 2021).

Scopus profile: https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=57198219493
Orcid profile: https://orcid.org/0000-0003-2116-2933
DBLP profile: https://dblp.org/pid/14/2922.html

Specialties: Text Mining, Natural Language Processing, Data Mining, Machine Learning, Web Mining, Search Engines, Ontologies, Semantic Enabled Search Technologies, Bioinformatics

projects.title: Fortissimo Drug-Target Binding Simulation
projects.description: The project aims at the advancement of drug development and drug repositioning via performing simulations of computational drug-target predictions following the SaaS paradigm. Drug-target binding simulations aim at the advancement of medical and biological knowledge at a fast pace and a low cost. The unique opportunity is to foster the developments towards the ultimate goal of having services which give accurate estimations of potential true positive drug-target bindings, by performing a computational simulation of the structures' bindings. It can be foreseen that in the next 5-10 years many groups worldwide will dive actively into this research topic which has a strong practical flavour, e.g., it aids drug development, enables drug repositioning, and at the long run it may help towards providing better treatment plans, especially for rare diseases. Towards the exploitation of the drug-target binding simulations results in this direction, we foresee the transfer of the project results into the business of the partners.

projects.title: OpenScienceLink: Open Semantically-enabled, Social-aware Access to Scientific Data
projects.description:
EU co-funded project under the call: CIP-ICT-PSP 2012 work programme topic 2.2 “Open Data and Open Access to Scientific Information”.
EU Grant Agreement N°: 325101
Starting Date: 01/02/2013
Ending Date: 31/01/2016

Summary:

OpenScienceLink is an EU-funded project which will introduce and pilot a holistic approach to the publication, sharing, linking, review and evaluation of research results, based on the open access to scientific information. OpenScienceLink will pilot a range of novel services that could alleviate the lack of structured data journals and associated data models, the weaknesses of the review process, the poor linking of scientific information, as well as the limitations of current research evaluation metrics and indicators. Five pilot services will be integrated and piloted in particular:

(a) Data journals development based on semantically-enabled research dynamics detection,

(b) a novel open, semantically-assisted peer review process,

(c) A services for detection and analysis of research trends,

(d) services for dynamic researchers’ collaboration based on non-declared, semantically-inferred relationships, and,

(e) a set of scientific field-aware, productivity- and impact-oriented enhanced research evaluation services.

These services will be developed over the OpenScienceLink platform, which will be based on the semantic and social networking capabilities of background FP7 projects, as well as of the popular GoPubMed search engine. The OpenScienceLink services will be piloted with the active participation of over 1200 researchers from the consortium organizations. OpenScienceLink will also study the business potential of open access paradigms, through investigating and pursuing multiple business models including author fees, hard copy sales, advertisements, sponsorship, as well as subscription based models. Finally, OpenScienceLink will devise and validate a legal framework for regulating and reusing open scientific data.

projects.title: BioASQ: A Challenge on large-scale biomedical semantic indexing and question answering
projects.description:
BIOASQ initiates a series of challenges on biomedical semantic indexing and question answering (QA). The challenge (aka competition or shared task) will assess:

    large-scale classification of biomedical documents onto ontology concepts (semantic indexing),
    classification of biomedical questions onto relevant concepts,
    retrieval of relevant document snippets, concepts and knowledge base triples,
    delivery of the retrieved information in a concise and user-understandable form.

projects.title: PONTE European Project (Efficient Patient Recruitment for Innovative Clinical Trials of Existing Drugs to other Indications)
projects.description:
PONTE is a European project standing for Efficient Patient Recruitment for Innovative Clinical Trials of Existing Drugs to other Indications.

PONTE aims at providing a platform following a Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) approach that will offer intelligent automatic identification of individuals eligible to participate in clinical trials (concerning their safety and clinical trial efficacy). The trials will be designed and planned through a flexible authoring tool, enabling semantic interoperability of clinical care information systems with clinical research information systems and drug and disease knowledge databases, as well as the appliance of advanced data mining techniques and enhanced learning algorithms

contributors.headline: Vice President Data Science, Research Content Operations at Elsevier

projects.title: CASAM European Project (Computer-Aided Semantic Annotation of Multimedia)
projects.description: CASAM introduces the concept of computer-aided semantic annotation to accelerate the adoption of semiautomatic multimedia annotation in the industry. The project is unique in that it facilitates the synergy of human and machine intelligence to significantly speed up the task of human-produced semantic annotation of multimedia content.

contributors.headline: Vice President Data Science, Research Content Operations at Elsevier
Director/Head of Data Science

projects.title: BOEMIE European Project (Bootstrapping Ontology Evolution with Multimedia Information Extraction)
projects.description: The BOEMIE project proposes a bootstrapping approach to knowledge acquisition, which uses multimedia ontologies for fused extraction of semantics from multiple modalities, and feeds back the extracted information, aiming to automate the ontology evolution process. BOEMIE methodology BOEMIE advocates an ontology-driven multimedia content analysis (semantics extraction from images, video, text, audio/speech) through a novel synergistic method that combines multimedia extraction and ontology evolution in a bootstrapping fashion.

projects.title: SQO-OSS European Project (Measuring Software Quality in an Open Source Context)
projects.description: SQO-OSS aims to improve the productivity of European software developers and the quality of their deliverables. The SQO-OSS project will establish and apply objective, automatable criteria for determining the quality of open source software systems and processes, based on a flexible and adaptable quality model. SQO-OSS will thus remove one of the key barriers to entry for Open Source software by providing scientific metrics of its quality. The results will be obtained by applying traditional software metrics as well as data mining techniques on a large variety of data sources.

profile_positions.description: I lead the RCO Data Science Department in the Operations division of Elsevier. Manned with highly skilled Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, Taxonomy, and Subject Matter Experts, the RCO Data Science department is responsible for developing novel capabilities for our research content products. We are highly specialized in information extraction, classification, clustering, search, taxonomy and ontology-based annotations of text, and QA of domain specific scientific content.
